DisplayObject.name: DisplayObject
DisplayObject.description:
The base class for all objects that are rendered. Contains properties for position, scaling,
rotation, masks and cache handling.

This is an abstract class and should not be used on its own, rather it should be extended.

It is used internally by the likes of PIXI.Sprite.

DisplayObjectContainer.name: DisplayObjectContainer
DisplayObjectContainer.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture for this sprite

CanvasBuffer.name: CanvasBuffer
CanvasBuffer.description: Creates a Canvas element of the given size.

params.name: width
params.description: the width for the newly created canvas

params.name: height
params.description: the height for the newly created canvas

CanvasMaskManager.name: CanvasMaskManager
CanvasMaskManager.description: A set of functions used to handle masking.

CanvasGraphics.name: CanvasGraphics
CanvasGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the canvas renderer to draw the primitive graphics data.

CanvasRenderer.name: CanvasRenderer
CanvasRenderer.description:
The CanvasRenderer draws the Stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.
Don't forget to add the CanvasRenderer.view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: game
params.description: A reference to the Phaser Game instance

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: width
params.description: the horizontal range of the filter

params.name: height
params.description: the vertical range of the filter

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

WebGLGraphics.name: WebGLGraphics
WebGLGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the webGL renderer to draw the primitive graphics data

WebGLRenderer.name: WebGLRenderer
WebGLRenderer.description:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: game
params.description: A reference to the Phaser Game instance

BaseTexture.name: BaseTexture
BaseTexture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image. All textures have a base texture.

params.name: source
params.description: the source object (image or canvas)

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

params.name: resolution
params.description: the resolution of the texture (for HiDPI displays)

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
A texture stores the information that represents an image or part of an image. It cannot be added
to the display list directly. Instead use it as the texture for a PIXI.Sprite. If no frame is provided then the whole image is used.

params.name: baseTexture
params.description: The base texture source to create the texture from

params.name: frame
params.description: The rectangle frame of the texture to show

params.name: crop
params.description: The area of original texture

params.name: trim
params.description: Trimmed texture rectangle

PIXI.name: PIXI
PIXI.description:
Namespace-class for [pixi.js](http://www.pixijs.com/).

Contains assorted static properties and enumerations.

classitems.description:
The coordinates, in pixels, of this DisplayObject, relative to its parent container.

The value of this property does not reflect any positioning happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldPosition` property.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description:
The scale of this DisplayObject. A scale of 1:1 represents the DisplayObject
at its default size. A value of 0.5 would scale this DisplayObject by half, and so on.

The value of this property does not reflect any scaling happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldScale` property.
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description:
The pivot point of this DisplayObject that it rotates around. The values are expressed
in pixel values.
classitems.name: pivot

classitems.description:
The rotation of this DisplayObject. The value is given, and expressed, in radians, and is based on
a right-handed orientation.

The value of this property does not reflect any rotation happening further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldRotation` property.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description:
The alpha value of this DisplayObject. A value of 1 is fully opaque. A value of 0 is transparent.
Please note that an object with an alpha value of 0 is skipped during the render pass.

The value of this property does not reflect any alpha values set further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldAlpha` property.
classitems.name: alpha

classitems.description:
The visibility of this DisplayObject. A value of `false` makes the object invisible.
A value of `true` makes it visible. Please note that an object with a visible value of
`false` is skipped during the render pass. Equally a DisplayObject with visible false will
not render any of its children.

The value of this property does not reflect any visible values set further up the display list.
To obtain that value please see the `worldVisible` property.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)
classitems.name: hitArea

classitems.description:
Should this DisplayObject be rendered by the renderer? An object with a renderable value of
`false` is skipped during the render pass.
classitems.name: renderable

classitems.description:
The parent DisplayObjectContainer that this DisplayObject is a child of.
All DisplayObjects must belong to a parent in order to be rendered.
The root parent is the Stage object. This property is set automatically when the
DisplayObject is added to, or removed from, a DisplayObjectContainer.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description:
The multiplied alpha value of this DisplayObject. A value of 1 is fully opaque. A value of 0 is transparent.
This value is the calculated total, based on the alpha values of all parents of this DisplayObjects 
in the display list.

To obtain, and set, the local alpha value, see the `alpha` property.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.
classitems.name: worldAlpha

classitems.description:
The current transform of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the transforms of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.
classitems.name: worldTransform

classitems.description:
The coordinates, in pixels, of this DisplayObject within the world.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the positions of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.
classitems.name: worldPosition

classitems.description:
The global scale of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the scales of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.
classitems.name: worldScale

classitems.description:
The rotation, in radians, of this DisplayObject.

This property contains the calculated total, based on the rotations of all parents of this 
DisplayObject in the display list.

Note: This property is only updated at the end of the `updateTransform` call, once per render. Until 
that happens this property will contain values based on the previous frame. Be mindful of this if
accessing this property outside of the normal game flow, i.e. from an asynchronous event callback.
classitems.name: worldRotation

classitems.description: The rectangular area used by filters when rendering a shader for this DisplayObject.
classitems.name: filterArea
_bounds - The cached bounds of this object.
_currentBounds - The most recently calculated bounds of this object.
_mask - The cached mask of this object.

classitems.description:
Destroy this DisplayObject.

Removes any cached sprites, sets renderable flag to false, and nulls filters, bounds and mask.

Also iteratively calls `destroy` on any children.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#destroy

classitems.description: To be overridden by classes that require it.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#preUpdate

classitems.description:
Generates a RenderTexture based on this DisplayObject, which can they be used to texture other Sprites.
This can be useful if your DisplayObject is static, or complicated, and needs to be reused multiple times.

Please note that no garbage collection takes place on old textures. It is up to you to destroy old textures,
and references to them, so they don't linger in memory.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#generateTexture

params.name: resolution
params.description: - The resolution of the texture being generated.

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: - See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values.

params.name: renderer
params.description: - The renderer used to generate the texture.

return.description: - A RenderTexture containing an image of this DisplayObject at the time it was invoked.

classitems.description: If this DisplayObject has a cached Sprite, this method generates and updates it.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#updateCache

classitems.description: Calculates the global position of this DisplayObject, based on the position given.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#toGlobal

params.name: position
params.description: - The global position to calculate from.

return.description: - A point object representing the position of this DisplayObject based on the global position given.

classitems.description: Calculates the local position of this DisplayObject, relative to another point.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#toLocal

params.name: position
params.description: - The world origin to calculate from.

params.name: from
params.description: - An optional DisplayObject to calculate the global position from.

return.description: - A point object representing the position of this DisplayObject based on the global position given.

classitems.description: Internal method.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#_renderCachedSprite

params.name: renderSession
params.description: - The render session

classitems.description: Internal method.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#_generateCachedSprite

classitems.description: Destroys a cached Sprite.
classitems.name: PIXI.DisplayObject#_destroyCachedSprite

classitems.description:
The horizontal position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.
If you need the world position of the DisplayObject, use `DisplayObject.worldPosition` instead.
classitems.name: x - The horizontal position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.

classitems.description:
The vertical position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.
If you need the world position of the DisplayObject, use `DisplayObject.worldPosition` instead.
classitems.name: y - The vertical position of the DisplayObject, in pixels, relative to its parent.

classitems.description: Indicates if this DisplayObject is visible, based on it, and all of its parents, `visible` property values.
classitems.name: worldVisible - Indicates if this DisplayObject is visible, based on it, and all of its parents, `visible` property values.

classitems.description:
Sets a mask for this DisplayObject. A mask is an instance of a Graphics object.
When applied it limits the visible area of this DisplayObject to the shape of the mask.
Under a Canvas renderer it uses shape clipping. Under a WebGL renderer it uses a Stencil Buffer.
To remove a mask, set this property to `null`.
classitems.name: mask - The mask applied to this DisplayObject. Set to `null` to remove an existing mask.

classitems.description:
Sets the filters for this DisplayObject. This is a WebGL only feature, and is ignored by the Canvas
Renderer. A filter is a shader applied to this DisplayObject. You can modify the placement of the filter
using `DisplayObject.filterArea`.

To remove filters, set this property to `null`.

Note: You cannot have a filter set, and a MULTIPLY Blend Mode active, at the same time. Setting a 
filter will reset this DisplayObjects blend mode to NORMAL.
classitems.name: filters - An Array of Phaser.Filter objects, or objects that extend them.

classitems.description:
Sets if this DisplayObject should be cached as a bitmap.

When invoked it will take a snapshot of the DisplayObject, as it is at that moment, and store it 
in a RenderTexture. This is then used whenever this DisplayObject is rendered. It can provide a
performance benefit for complex, but static, DisplayObjects. I.e. those with lots of children.

Cached Bitmaps do not track their parents. If you update a property of this DisplayObject, it will not
re-generate the cached bitmap automatically. To do that you need to call `DisplayObject.updateCache`.

To remove a cached bitmap, set this property to `null`.
classitems.name: cacheAsBitmap - Cache this DisplayObject as a Bitmap. Set to `null` to remove an existing cached bitmap.

classitems.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description:
If `ignoreChildInput`  is `false` it will allow this objects _children_ to be considered as valid for Input events.

If this property is `true` then the children will _not_ be considered as valid for Input events.

Note that this property isn't recursive: only immediate children are influenced, it doesn't scan further down.
classitems.name: ignoreChildInput

classitems.name: addChild

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

params.name: index
params.description: The index to place the child in

params.name: child

classitems.description: Removes a child from the specified index position.
classitems.name: removeChildAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index to get the child from

classitems.description: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.
classitems.name: removeChildren

params.name: beginIndex
params.description: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

params.name: endIndex
params.description: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

classitems.description: Retrieves the global bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.
classitems.name: getBounds

params.name: targetCoordinateSpace
params.description: Returns a rectangle that defines the area of the display object relative to the coordinate system of the targetCoordinateSpace object.

classitems.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle without any transformations. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.
classitems.name: getLocalBounds

classitems.description: Determines whether the specified display object is a child of the DisplayObjectContainer instance or the instance itself.
classitems.name: contains

classitems.name: _renderWebGL

classitems.name: _renderCanvas

classitems.description: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner
classitems.name: anchor

classitems.description: The texture that the sprite is using
classitems.name: texture

classitems.description: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: _width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: _height

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.
classitems.name: tint

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.
classitems.name: cachedTint

classitems.description: A canvas that contains the tinted version of the Sprite (in Canvas mode, WebGL doesn't populate this)
classitems.name: tintedTexture

classitems.description:
The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

Warning: You cannot have a blend mode and a filter active on the same Sprite. Doing so will render the sprite invisible.
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description:
The shader that will be used to render this Sprite.
Set to null to remove a current shader.
classitems.name: shader

classitems.description: Controls if this Sprite is processed by the core Phaser game loops and Group loops.
classitems.name: exists

classitems.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
Sets the texture of the sprite. Be warned that this doesn't remove or destroy the previous
texture this Sprite was using.
classitems.name: setTexture

params.name: texture
params.description: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

params.name: destroy
params.description: Call Texture.destroy on the current texture before replacing it with the new one?

classitems.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame
classitems.name: onTextureUpdate

classitems.description:
Returns the bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle.
The bounds calculation takes the worldTransform into account.

It is important to note that the transform is not updated when you call this method.
So if this Sprite is the child of a Display Object which has had its transform
updated since the last render pass, those changes will not yet have been applied
to this Sprites worldTransform. If you need to ensure that all parent transforms
are factored into this getBounds operation then you should call `updateTransform`
on the root most object in this Sprites display list first.
classitems.name: getBounds

params.name: matrix
params.description: the transformation matrix of the sprite

classitems.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.
classitems.name: getLocalBounds

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer
classitems.name: _renderWebGL

params.name: matrix
params.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer
classitems.name: _renderCanvas

params.name: matrix
params.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

classitems.description:
This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color.
If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.
classitems.name: clearBeforeRender

classitems.author:
Mat Groves

Big thanks to the very clever Matt DesLauriers <mattdesl> https://github.com/mattdesl/
for creating the original pixi version!
Also a thanks to https://github.com/bchevalier for tweaking the tint and alpha so that they now share 4 bytes on the vertex buffer

Heavily inspired by LibGDX's WebGLSpriteBatch:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g2d/WebGLSpriteBatch.java

classitems.description: The value of the preserveDrawingBuffer flag affects whether or not the contents of the stencil buffer is retained after rendering.
classitems.name: preserveDrawingBuffer

classitems.description:
This sets if the WebGLRenderer will clear the context texture or not before the new render pass. If true:
If the Stage is NOT transparent, Pixi will clear to alpha (0, 0, 0, 0).
If the Stage is transparent, Pixi will clear to the target Stage's background color.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example: if your game has a canvas filling background image, you often don't need this set.
classitems.name: clearBeforeRender

classitems.description: The width of the canvas view
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the canvas view
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The canvas element that everything is drawn to
classitems.name: view

classitems.name: stencilManager

classitems.description: Manages the blendModes
classitems.name: blendModeManager

classitems.description:
If Multi Texture support has been enabled, then calling this method will enable batching on the given
textures. The texture collection is an array of keys, that map to Phaser.Cache image entries.

The number of textures that can be batched is dependent on hardware. If you provide more textures
than can be batched by the GPU, then only those at the start of the array will be used. Generally
you shouldn't provide more than 16 textures to this method. You can check the hardware limit via the
`maxTextures` property.

You can also check the property `currentBatchedTextures` at any time, to see which textures are currently
being batched.

To stop all textures from being batched, call this method again with an empty array.

To change the textures being batched, call this method with a new array of image keys. The old ones
will all be purged out and no-longer batched, and the new ones enabled.

Note: Throws a warning if you haven't enabled Multiple Texture batching support in the Phaser Game config.
classitems.name: setTexturePriority

params.name: textureNameCollection
params.description: An Array of Texture Cache keys to use for multi-texture batching.

return.description: An array containing the texture keys that were enabled for batching.

classitems.description:
Set this to true if a mipmap of this texture needs to be generated. This value needs to be set before the texture is used
Also the texture must be a power of two size to work
classitems.name: mipmap

classitems.description: The multi texture batching index number.
classitems.name: textureIndex

classitems.description:
A BaseTexture can be set to skip the rendering phase in the WebGL Sprite Batch.

You may want to do this if you have a parent Sprite with no visible texture (i.e. uses the internal `__default` texture)
that has children that you do want to render, without causing a batch flush in the process.
classitems.name: skipRender

classitems.description:
Forces this BaseTexture to be set as loaded, with the given width and height.
Then calls BaseTexture.dirty.
Important for when you don't want to modify the source object by forcing in `complete` or dimension properties it may not have.
classitems.name: forceLoaded

params.name: width
params.description: - The new width to force the BaseTexture to be.

params.name: height
params.description: - The new height to force the BaseTexture to be.

classitems.description: Destroys this base texture
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.name: updateSourceImage

params.name: newSrc
params.description: the path of the image

classitems.deprecationMessage: This method is deprecated. Please use Phaser.Sprite.loadTexture instead.

classitems.description: Sets all glTextures to be dirty.
classitems.name: dirty

classitems.description:
Removes the base texture from the GPU, useful for managing resources on the GPU.
Atexture is still 100% usable and will simply be reuploaded if there is a sprite on screen that is using it.
classitems.name: unloadFromGPU

params.name: resolution
params.description: the resolution of the texture (for HiDPI displays)

classitems.description:
TextureSilentFail is a boolean that defaults to `false`. 
If `true` then `PIXI.Texture.setFrame` will no longer throw an error if the texture dimensions are incorrect. 
Instead `Texture.valid` will be set to `false` (#1556)
Does this Texture have any frame data assigned to it?
classitems.name: noFrame

classitems.description: The base texture that this texture uses.
classitems.name: baseTexture

classitems.description: The frame specifies the region of the base texture that this texture uses
classitems.name: frame

classitems.description: The texture trim data.
classitems.name: trim

classitems.description: This will let the renderer know if the texture is valid. If it's not then it cannot be rendered.
classitems.name: valid

classitems.description: Is this a tiling texture? As used by the likes of a TilingSprite.
classitems.name: isTiling

classitems.description: This will let a renderer know that a texture has been updated (used mainly for webGL uv updates)
classitems.name: requiresUpdate

classitems.description: This will let a renderer know that a tinted parent has updated its texture.
classitems.name: requiresReTint

classitems.description: The WebGL UV data cache.
classitems.name: _uvs

classitems.description: The width of the Texture in pixels.
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the Texture in pixels.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
This is the area of the BaseTexture image to actually copy to the Canvas / WebGL when rendering,
irrespective of the actual frame size or placement (which can be influenced by trimmed texture atlases)
classitems.name: crop

classitems.description:
A flag that controls if this frame is rotated or not.
Rotation allows you to use rotated frames in texture atlas packing, it has nothing to do with
Sprite rotation.
classitems.name: rotated

warnings.message: replacing incorrect tag: returns with return

Missing item type
If true Pixi will Math.floor() x/y values when rendering, stopping pixel interpolation.
Handy for crisp pixel art and speed on legacy devices.

Missing item type
The number of points beyond which Pixi swaps to using the Stencil Buffer to render the Graphics.

Missing item type
TextureSilentFail is a boolean that defaults to `false`. 
If `true` then `PIXI.Texture.setFrame` will no longer throw an error if the texture dimensions are incorrect. 
Instead `Texture.valid` will be set to `false` (#1556)
